page.title: 17Summary of Great Shelford
page.content: Great Shelford is considered an up market housing area. It is very atractive with many trees and appears to be a rather unspoilt English village. Many of the older houses are built in the typical Cambridge style, i.e. yellowish coloured bricks and a rather plain architectural style. There are many small shops, but most people with cars do their shopping in Cambridge which is close by. Many people also work in Cambridge and this role as a commuting village has grown in recent years. There is a limited train service to the village but most people rely on private transport. The village has a good community spirit and thriving organisations such as the W.I. To the south-east Shelford joins the village of Stapleford and it is now difficult to separate the two.
